Detailed Description

template<typename AbsVarRef1, typename AbsVarRef2>
struct AbsConstraint< AbsVarRef1, AbsVarRef2 >

constraints;abs Description The constraint

abs(x,y)

makes sure that x=|y|, i.e. x is the absolute value of y. constraints;abs Reference help constraints abs

template<typename AbsVarRef1, typename AbsVarRef2>
virtual triggerCollection AbsConstraint< AbsVarRef1, AbsVarRef2 >::setup_internal (  )  [inline, virtual]

Gets all the triggers a constraint wants to set up.

This function shouldn't do any propagation. That is full_propagate's job.

Definition at line 126 of file constraint_abs.h.

template<typename AbsVarRef1, typename AbsVarRef2>
virtual bool AbsConstraint< AbsVarRef1, AbsVarRef2 >::get_satisfying_assignment ( box< pair< int, DomainInt > > &  assignment  )  [inline, virtual]

Looks for a valid partial assignment to a constraint.

The return value (in the box) is pairs of <varnum, domain value>, where varnum is in the same position as returned by get_vars.
